title: custom type "kontakt" by dstype / similar font needed
content:
hi,

i really, really like “kontakt” by dstype.  
unfortunately it is a custom font and therefore not available for licensing.

who can help me: which fonts look very similar?

thanks,  
ulli.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [kontakt.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122044800/http:/typophile.com/files/kontakt.png) | 73.91 KB |

 [‹ Bath&Body "pampering" informal script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122044800/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40711 "Go to previous forum topic") [Air Canada enRoute Magazine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122044800/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40703 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ulli

comments.content:
Hi Ulli,

I’d say [Miller](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122044800/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Miller/charset) has a similar feel.  
F
Good call, Florian. I also see some [Corporate A](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122044800/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/corporate_a/) in there.
H&FJ’s Chronicle isn’t too far off the mark.
I have to agree with Florian. I would go for Miller.

thank you for your answers.  
right, “miller” is really close.

but i totally disagree with stephen, corporate occurs very different to me.  
o.k. the line “DIE MÖGLICHKEIT” in dstype’s sample looks like it could be from a mercedes benz ad but “kontakt” has a more solid standing to me.
I was referring to the light weight, yes. The long serif forms are similar.
